meta.content: Theater; Corrections; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

abstract.p: Correction: October 30 article in Weekend section on ethnic theater in New York, which misspelled two names

block.p: An article in Weekend on Friday about ethnic theater in the New York region misspelled the given name of the founder of the Pan Asian Repertory. She is Tisa Chang, not Tisha.

The article also misspelled the surname of a Detroit resident who was beaten to death by two unemployed auto workers in 1982 and whose story is being told in ''Carry the Tiger to the Mountain,'' the Pan Asian's next production. He is Vincent Chin, not Chen.
An article in Weekend on Friday about ethnic theater in the New York region misspelled the given name of the founder of the Pan Asian Repertory. She is Tisa Chang, not Tisha.

The article also misspelled the surname of a Detroit resident who was beaten to death by two unemployed auto workers in 1982 and whose story is being told in ''Carry the Tiger to the Mountain,'' the Pan Asian's next production. He is Vincent Chin, not Chen.
